column2: Plastic, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

Plus the new breakouts now and then..

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This product has been amazing at treating my adult acne.  I started getting acne as an adult about a year ago and could not find anything that would effectively treat it.  It also became painful so I decided to go to the dermatologist.  He prescribed Benzaclin and I found relief within two days (my acne was almost completely gone).  I have been using it for three months and my skin is now clear.

column2: luanlegacy, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been using Benzaclin for just about a week now, and I haven't really noticed a spefific difference. but during the 5 days I've used it, I've developed 3 HUGE/painful cysts on my face. like absolutely terrible, and goign to highschool, thats not something you want. i want to give it a good review, but i just don't see results, I might write again after I've used it longer, but right now. its preety mediocre

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am 24 years old and really started breaking out when I was about 20. I have tried everything to help get rid of the acne, and this has been the only thing that has really ever helped me. When not using the medication, I get all types of breakouts (whiteheads, blackheads, under the skin etc.) and once I get my rx refilled and start using this again, I see an almost immediate improvement. The only downside that I have found is that there is no generic of the medication, which would be more cost effective for me. But this works great for me!

column2: 2hot4ewe,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 33 years old and started developing acne for the first time when I turned 30. Ive been using this for 2 years and my skin has never looked better. Only downside is its drying so I be sure to use a light moisturizer during the day which relieves the dryness.

column2: sweetnis600, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using benzalin for about two months, and its's worked pretty well...I can't say that i have bad acne but i did have small "under the skin" pipples always lurking(it has totally helped reduce those).I generally got bad zits around my period it has definitly helped calm those breakouts also.I still get a red bad boy here or there but it does shorten the life span. I hope this helps anyone in need i have tried close to everything and have had no where near these results.I say try it GOOD LUCK!!!

column2: mimosa_1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been using benzaclin for 2 weeks now, and in combination with minocycline, so far it's the only thing that has worked for my adult acne. Great product!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I used a lot of OTC stuff and didn't get much results. Finally I found something that helped but didn't completely take all the acne away which was the Philosophy treatment OTC. However, now I switch to this acne medicine and am now seeing better results faster. It's only been 3 days and we'll see how it goes. I only use it at night because I'm afraid of the over drying and I'm still seeing the results. I also use a moisturizer.

column2: Acne-phobia female, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had acne since I was 18yrs, have tried everything: Obagi, retin A, proactive, clarisonic brush, department store creams...you name it, I never looked at the price tag since all I wanted was the acne to be OUT OF MY FACE. Nothing worked for me, I have been using Benzaclin along w/cetaphil face wash and cetaphil moisturizer for about 1 week and already see the difference, nothing is completely gone but I can tell the medication is working since my acne has gone down dramatically. Thank God for Benzaclin, trust me, I have spend good $$$ and nothing worked before. The side effects are not bad at all for me, I'm a Latino female 33 yrs old and my face is not red, a little dry than usual, but that should be somethin good, right? Good luck to you all

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 33 yrs. old and started to get acne all over my face but mainly on my cheeks.  I've had acne in the past but it was controllable. It became so bad I thought I might get scars.  I tried proactive and every other otc med I could find.  I finally went to a dermatologist who gave me antibiotics and three different types of cream, one of which was benzaclin.  Benzclin was the only thing that worked.  It has been three months now and my skin is the clearest it has ever been.  I highly recommend that anyone who has problem acne try this product.  Initially I used it twice a day, now I use it just once at night.  It does not dry out my skin or make it red and sensitive.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I'm now 24 and I've suffered from acne since I was 12.  I've use Proactive and also a combination prescription pill/cream and Benzaclin is the ONLY thing that has worked for me.  I'm really not sure if people are slathering it on or what but I just do a thin layer in the morning and wait five minutes and it's never stained or bleached my clothes.  I use Cetaphil daily facial moisturizer with SPF 15 and have never had any skin dryness or sunburn while using Benzaclin.  It's just amazing.  The only thing I would say is don't quit if your skin gets better!  It will get worse again and it takes some time for Benzaclin to start working.  Great product, life saver, and cheaper than the combined costs of the hundreds of OTC remedies I've tried.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've struggled with acne since I was a preteen. My doctors have tried a mulitude of meds, but my new dermatologist put me a daily routine that includes benzaclin. I was my face day and night with a prescription medicated wash and use benzaclin in the morning and retin-a micro at night. While I have experienced the typical peeling, redness and burning, the combination of the three have kept my blackheads, pimples and cysts at bay.

column2: Elle707, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only been using Benzaclin for a few days now, but I already see a difference. It shrank two cysts dramatically already. I have been using it twice a day and it is drying and leaves your skin pink, but it doesn't look bad. Be sure to use a non comedogenic moisturizer. My skin is also much smoother all over.

column2: freebird, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I'm a 35yr old female w/ cystic acne, I've tried everything you can buy over the counter and nothing helped. I finally went to my doctor, he put me on Benzaclin and it has helped alot more than any of the stuff I've tried before. He also put me on Bactroban Cream which is really good, if not better than the Benzaclin. I hope this info will help someone else. :)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

This is some GREAT stuff!!  It didn't dry my face out either...which is great!  I'd definately recommend it!
